DOC.detailed_description: Opioid dependence continue major public health concern United States , prescription opioid abuse rapidly become one nation 's big drug problem . Although substantial improvement pharmacological treatment opioid dependence , many patient relapse soon detoxification . In China country , acupuncture effective treatment heroin dependence . The current study test whether electroacupuncture , provide adjunctive treatment , produce improved outcome among patient receive inpatient detoxification opioids . The primary hypothesis participant receive active electroacupuncture , compare receive sham electroacupuncture , experience milder withdrawal symptom , report less opioid craving , maintain abstinence opioids long duration follow discharge . This study single-blind , randomize clinical trial participant receive either active sham electroacupuncture . Participants recruit inpatient unit Alcohol Drug Abuse Treatment Program McLean Hospital . Participants receive thrice daily 30-minute electroacupuncture treatment 4 day . The Han 's Acupoint Nerve Stimulator device use stimulate acupoints one hand ( LI4/P8 ) opposite arm ( P6/TE5 ) . This device emit constant electric current transcutaneously via skin electrode stimulate relevant acupoints . It use needle harmful side-effects . Participants follow 2 week follow discharge . Assessments occur daily treatment phase weekly follow-up phase . Assessments include clinical interview , questionnaire , urine toxicology screen , medical record review . The result study indicate whether short-term electroacupuncture may benefit individual receive inpatient detoxification opioids .
